result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:45 AM CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: K Kittel. Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Joel David Schlitz appeared by video w/Rebecca Jean Ann Dufresne who also appeared by video. records.addlTxt:
10:03 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Rebecca Jean Ann Dufresne in court. Court reviews case. DE states turned in PFAC to jail staff. Recess 10:03 AM. Back on Record 10:16 AM. Same appearances. Court sets STC. Adjourned 10:18 AM
Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on September 1, 2022 at 09:45 am.
filed by DA's Office on behalf of VW. bph

ADDRESS INFO for Rebecca Jean Ann Dufresne
Current: 405 Spring Street, PO Box 339, Somerset, WI 54025   (Effective: 08-23-2022)
Prior: 405 Spring Street, Somerset, WI 54025 
Per bond signed by DE.  gll

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least 4 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

- Defendant shall contact Kara Rheingans, Case Manager - Behavioral Health at 715-716-0920 within 48 hours. Ms. Rheingans shall conduct an intake screening to determine appropriateness for inclusion in programming offered by Behavioral Health. If you are screened in for services, you shall participate in programming as recommended. Failure to contact Ms. Rheingans or participate may be considered a violation of your bond.

1:15 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court. Defendant Rebecca Jeanann Dufresne in court, in custody. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court enters NG plea and reserves on pre-plea rights. Court to consider modifying bond if Agent believes testing with probation will be sufficient. Court sets STC. Adjourned 01:21 PM
Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
